title: Hall of Fame QB believes Drake Maye is playing too much ‘backyard football’ to say he’s taken next step
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "We're seeing some big-time plays and some good quarterback play.
But right now, I'm seeing too much look at one guy and go create.

title: Mike Vrabel won’t say if Christian Gonzalez suffered setback with hamstring injury
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Gonzalez will be questionable for Sunday's Patriots game against the Saints after appearing on the injury report this week.
Christian Gonzalez made his season debut in the Patriots' Week 4 win over the Panthers.

title: Chik-fil-A lands at Logan Airport
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel A second location will open in Terminal E in 2026.
Richard Davey, CEO of the Massachusetts Port Authority, was one of the first in line at Chick-fil-A in Terminal A at Logan Airport during the ribbon-cutting celebration on Thursday.
Michael Blanchard Travelers flying in and out of Boston can now “Eat Mor Chikin.

title: 5 Celtics takeaways from the annual NBA GM survey
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics General managers expect the Celtics to take a big step back this season, but Joe Mazzulla and Jayson Tatum got some respect in some of the categories.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla was a top vote-getter for a couple of different categories in the NBA GM survey.

(AP Photo/Brandon Dill) By Conor Roche October 10, 2025 | 2:34 PM 4 minutes to read NBA general managers are also expecting the Celtics to take a step back in 2025-26 with Jayson Tatum set to miss the majority of the season.

title: Report: Mass. sees second-biggest dip in monthly mortgage payments in the U.S.

A "for sale" sign in front of a suburban house.
Shutterstock After years of surging borrowing costs, mortgage rates are finally inching down, and the savings are meaningful for Massachusetts homebuyers.

title: Woman dies in Lawrence after being pinned by her own car
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The woman had exited her vehicle in order to attend to her infant child.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A woman died in Lawrence this week after her vehicle rolled back into her and pinned her against another car, according to police.
